page.title: 14Oldmeldrum Community Council
page.content: The Community Council for Meldrum and Bourtie plays an active part in community welfare and representation. It is awarded aproximately Â£200 each year by Gordon District Council, plus expenses, for use in the communtiy. Meetings are held once a month in Oldmeldrum Town Hall and members include Chairman Cecil Webster, secretary Mrs Gloria Fiddes, Mrs Ethel Manson, Ian Peddie, Forbes Green, Drew Phillip. The council is supporter of the annual Britian in Bloom contest in which villages and townships compete for a horticultural prize. Since Oldmeldrum is the home of William Forsyth (1727-1804), gardener to King George III, after whom the shrub Forsythia is named, the council encourages local gardeners to extract the most colour from their gardens for the beneit and pleasure of residents.
